title: Modify myA outside SomeClass - write code

content.question: Which of the following methods can be added to SomeClass to allow other classes to modify the value of myA?

choices.label: public void setA(int newA) { myA = newA; }
private void setA(int newA) { myA = newA; }
public void setA(int newA) { newA = myA; }
private void setA(int newA) { newA = myA; }

content.answer: public void setA(int newA) { myA = newA; }

skill.text: 2.C: Write program code involving procedural abstractions.
